App description:
Developed over five years by industry veterans (Metal Gear Solid, Halo, F.E.A.R.), RPUBLIQUE is a thrilling and topical stealth-action game that explores the perils of government surveillance in the Internet Age.

You receive a call from Hope, a woman trapped inside a mysterious totalitarian state. By hacking into the nation's elaborate surveillance network and taking control, you guide Hope through a web of danger and deception across five thrilling episodes.

 Immersive puzzles and strategic choices
 Innovative, interactive developer commentary 
 Incredible voiceover performances, starring:
o Rena Strober
o David Hayter (Metal Gear Solid)
o Jennifer Hale (Mass Effect, BioShock Infinite)
o Dwight Schultz (killer7, Star Trek)
o Khary Payton (Metal Gear Solid 4)
Purchase section: $14.99Add to WishlistShareComfortableSupports QuestSupports Oculus TouchInternet connection requiredOculus Refund Policy
Languages: English, Chinese (China), French (France), German, Japanese, Portuguese (Brazil), Russian, Spanish (Spain)

RPUBLIQUE PRIVACY POLICY

This page is used to inform Google Play users ofRpubliqueof our Privacy policies with regards to collection, use, and disclosure of Personal Information if anyone decided to use our Service.

If you choose to use our Service, you agree to the collection and use of information in relation to this policy. The Personal Information that we collect is used for providing and improving the Service. We will not use or share your information with anyone except as described in this Privacy Policy.

The terms used in this Privacy Policy have the same meanings as in our Terms and Conditions, which is accessible at Rpublique unless otherwise defined in this Privacy Policy.

Information Collection and Use

For a better experience, while using our Service, we may require you to provide us with certain personally identifiable information, including but not limited to default device specification information in order to allow the Service modify quality settings based on optimal performance specific to your device. We do not store, send, or otherwise analyze any private data outside of device default configuration profile.. The information that we request is will be retained by us and used as described in this privacy policy.

Security

We value your trust in providing us your Personal Information, thus we are striving to use commercially acceptable means of protecting it. But remember that no method of transmission over the internet, or method of electronic storage is 100% secure and reliable, and we cannot guarantee its absolute security.

Childrens Privacy

These Services do not address anyone under the age of 13. We do not knowingly collect personally identifiable information from children under 13. In the case we discover that a child under 13 has provided us with personal information, we immediately delete this from our servers. If you are a parent or guardian and you are aware that your child has provided us with personal information, please contact us so that we will be able to do necessary actions.

Changes to This Privacy Policy

We may update our Privacy Policy from time to time. Thus, you are advised to review this page periodically for any changes. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page. These changes are effective immediately after they are posted on this page.

Contact Us

If you have any questions or suggestions about our Privacy Policy, do not hesitate to contact us atprivacy@camouflaj.com.

3. HEALTH AND SAFETY.

This Section must be reviewed and understood prior to accessing and using the Game, and failure to do so may result in bodily harm or property damage. The health and safety precautions in this Section are not intended to be an exhaustive list, and use of the Game may involve other health and/or safety risks not contained herein.

3.1 Children.

Children using the Game must be supervised by an adult at all times. Adults should monitor children both during and after use of the Game for any adverse health symptoms, as further described below.

3.2 Health Warning.

Using virtual reality headsets, playing virtual Games, or accessing virtual reality experiences (including this Game) could have adverse health effects for some users that may occur both during and after use of the Game , including but not limited to: motion sickness, nausea, dizziness, poor balance, weakened hand-eye coordination, decreased multi-tasking ability, loss of or impaired consciousness or awareness, eye strain, altered vision, skin irritations, muscle soreness or twitching, convulsions or seizure, involuntary movements, disorientation, and discomfort. You or your child must stop playing the Game and consult a doctor if any of the foregoing symptoms or any other adverse symptoms occur during or after use of the Game. Camouflaj does not give medical advice. You must consult a doctor before using the Game if you are pregnant or if you have, or your child has, any pre-existing health condition that may be affected or worsened by using the Game, or if you have any other concerns about the health impact of using the Game.

3.3 Play Area Precautions.

As the Game is an immersive virtual reality experience, you must take necessary precautions to ensure your own safety (as well as the safety of others) while you or others are using the Game. While using the Game, users may be moving around the surrounding area, including making hand gestures or other movements. Before playing the Game, users must ensure that the surrounding area is free of all potential hazards and must maintain a reasonable distance from other individuals in the surrounding area. Users may not use the Game near objects, stairs, balconies, windows, walls, furniture, or other objects that may pose a danger or that could be damaged during or immediately after using the Game. Due to the immersive nature of the Game, sound volumes should be kept at low enough levels such that you are able to maintain awareness of your surroundings while using the Game.

3.4 Other Prohibited Uses.

Do not use the Game when you are tired, under the influence of alcohol or drugs, hung-over, experiencing digestive problems, under emotional stress or anxiety, or suffering from cold, flu, headaches, migraines, earaches, or other health issues which may increase your susceptibility to adverse symptoms or reactions, including as described in Section 3.2. Do not drive, operate heavy machinery, or engage in other demanding or strenuous activity while playing the Game or shortly thereafter, or while you are experiencing any health-related symptoms or illness. Never handle sharp or dangerous objects while playing the Game.

14. DISPUTE RESOLUTION AND ARBITRATION.

14.1 Generally.

In the interest of resolving disputes between you and Camouflaj in the most expedient and cost effective manner, you and Camouflaj agree that every dispute arising in connection with this EULA will be resolved by confidential, binding arbitration. Arbitration is more informal than a lawsuit in court. Arbitration uses a neutral arbitrator instead of a judge or jury, may allow for more limited discovery than in court, and can be subject to very limited review by courts. Arbitrators can award the same damages and relief that a court can award. Our agreement to arbitrate disputes includes all claims arising out of or relating to any aspect of this EULA, whether based in contract, tort, statute, fraud, misrepresentation, or any other legal theory, and regardless of whether a claim arises during or after the termination of this EULA. 14.3 Arbitrator.

Any arbitration between you and Camouflaj will be governed by the Commercial Dispute Resolution Procedures and the Supplementary Procedures for Consumer Related Disputes (collectively, "AAA Rules") of the American Arbitration Association ("AAA"), as modified by this EULA, and will be administered by the AAA. The AAA Rules and filing forms are available online at www.adr.org, by calling the AAA at 1-800-778-7879, or by contacting Camouflaj.

14.4 Notice; Process.

A party who intends to seek arbitration must first send a written notice of the dispute to the other, by certified mail or Federal Express (signature required), or if we do not have a physical address on file for you, by electronic mail ("Notice"). Camouflajs address for Notice is: Camouflaj, 110 110th AVE NE STE 350, Bellevue WA 98004. The Notice must: (a) describe the nature and basis of the claim or dispute; and (b) set forth the specific relief sought ("Demand"). We agree to use good faith efforts to resolve the claim directly, but if we do not reach an agreement to do so within thirty (30) days after the Notice is received, you or Camouflaj may commence an arbitration proceeding. During the arbitration, the amount of any settlement offer made by you or Camouflaj must not be disclosed to the arbitrator until after the arbitrator makes a final decision and award, if any. If our dispute is finally resolved through arbitration in your favor, Camouflaj will pay you the highest of the following: (i) the amount awarded by the arbitrator, if any; (ii) the last written settlement amount offered by Camouflaj in settlement of the dispute prior to the arbitrators award; or (iii) $1,000.

14.5 Fees.

If you commence arbitration in accordance with this EULA, Camouflaj will reimburse you for your payment of the filing fee, unless your claim is for more than $10,000, in which case the payment of any fees will be decided by the AAA Rules. Any arbitration hearing will take place at a location to be agreed upon in Santa Clara, California, but if the claim is for $10,000 or less, you may choose whether the arbitration will be conducted: (a) solely on the basis of documents submitted to the arbitrator; (b) through a non-appearance based telephone hearing; or (c) by an in-person hearing as established by the AAA Rules in the county (or parish) of your billing address. If the arbitrator finds that either the substance of your claim or the relief sought in the Demand is frivolous or brought for an improper purpose (as measured by the standards set forth in Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 11(b)), then the payment of all fees will be governed by the AAA Rules. In that case, you agree to reimburse Camouflaj for all monies previously disbursed by it that are otherwise your obligation to pay under the AAA Rules. Regardless of the manner in which the arbitration is conducted, the arbitrator must issue a reasoned written decision sufficient to explain the essential findings and conclusions on which the decision and award, if any, are based. The arbitrator may make rulings and resolve disputes as to the payment and reimbursement of fees or expenses at any time during the proceeding and upon request from either party made within fourteen (14) days of the arbitrators ruling on the merits.

14.6 No Class Actions.

YOU AND CAMOUFLAJ AGREE THAT EACH MAY BRING CLAIMS AGAINST THE OTHER ONLY IN YOUR OR ITS INDIVIDUAL CAPACITY AND NOT AS A PLAINTIFF OR CLASS MEMBER IN ANY PURPORTED CLASS OR REPRESENTATIVE PROCEEDING. Further, unless both you and Camouflaj agree otherwise, the arbitrator may not consolidate more than one persons claims, and may not otherwise preside over any form of a representative or class proceeding.

14.7 Modifications

If Camouflaj makes any future change to this arbitration provision (other than a change to Camouflajs address for Notice), you may reject the change by sending us written notice within thirty (30) days of the change to Camouflajs address for Notice, in which case your account with Camouflaj will be immediately terminated and this arbitration provision, as in effect immediately prior to the amendments you reject, will survive.

14.8 Enforceability

If Section 14.6 is found to be unenforceable or if the entirety of this Section 14 is found to be unenforceable, then the entirety of this Section 14 will be null and void and, in that case, the parties agree that the exclusive jurisdiction and venue described in Section 13 will govern any action arising out of or related to this EULA.

15. GENERAL.

This EULA, together with the Privacy Policy and any Additional Terms, and any other agreements expressly incorporated by reference herein, are the entire and exclusive understanding and agreement between you and Camouflaj regarding your use of the Service (including the Game). SimonRigotJun 11 at 5:24 AM
hard to get on but astonishing

I bought the game at Christmas and tried it out a bit, then stopped because I didnt understand the right way.I tried back in March because of Corona confinement, and again didnt get any clue. I was truely desperate and frustrated until I got back in may and slightly began to understand the gameplay. And the more I get into the story the more I am astonished by the gameplay, storytelling , and puzzles are pretty enjoyable to. I am not yet finished , already in the beginning of level 4 and pretty sure when Ill reach the end Ill try again with other profiles . Congratulations to the developers team it is a masterpiece

TeonisJul 14 at 12:08 AM
A pretty good stealth game

I was not disappointed. I started to play this on my smartphone, but never finished it. It was a great game on mobile, and an excellent experience in VR. The gameplay is great, the stealth part is working, the story is deep, has a ton of collectible background info. The actors (David Hayter!!!) are really good.

I can only recommend this game! Not for everyone, but give it a try!

FatSheamusMay 15 at 10:43 PM
Pretty but...

Honestly I grew entirely bored after about an hour of gameplay. Maybe it was the subject matter, maybe it was the slightly convoluted plot and drab characters. Whichever the case, I just wasn't thrilled with how it all played out.
I don't know, maybe its just me.

Helpful | 34

Golden_MindMay 23 at 6:26 AM
There is hope?

Originally dubious about playing a game where you do nothing except guide someone.

Oh but you mentally guide them, you care for them and you fear for them.

There are moment when you have to strategise and plan your move really carefully, one wrong move and back to the confinement room.

Either standing or sitting but very little movement apart from pointing and turning your head.

It's absorbing of time.

Wonderful storyline, the ending is lacking a bit of hope but, she wants to be free.

Final thoughts.. strategically tough but an ending of hope.

Worth more than 10.99.

Fun and Addictive

Update: Pretty cool game. Not sure if I cared for the ending. Hope more games are created like this one, Fun and lengthy.
I really enjoy this game. Took me a while to get pass episode 1, but once i did, I started rolling. I really like it, it is very addictive. Long but fun enough to keep you entertain as you try to get past the Prizracks. Pleeeze develop more games similar to this one!!

Great Game

Ive been playing this game since it came out on IOS. Waited months for each chapter to come out. I even bought an IPad with more space just so I had enough space for each chapter as they came out. Im definitely a fan. I was not disappointed when I bought and played this game on VR. Visually its so much more in depth than on the IPad. You can immerse yourself for hours just playing and really following the story. Each time I play it I challenge myself to do something like pickpocket every Prizraak or find every tape etc. The devs really did put a lot into this game and it shows. Ive not had any issues with crashing or losing my game on the Quest. You can play this sitting the whole time if you choose. I do recommend this game and Id definitely buy another Camouflaj title.

technoticJul 25, 2019 at 11:39 AM
A different take on VR immersion!

I pre-ordered this game because the trailer was well put together, and it looked like something different than anything available on the Quest so far. It was released a little over an hour ago, and I only stopped playing to take a break and write this review.
Cost: 5 stars - I would have paid twice as much for this game. Worth every penny
Graphics: 5 stars - The devs put this together beautifully. They put the detail where it needs to be.
Story: 5 stars - The game jumps you right in and the story just flows and draws you in perfectly.
Immersion: 5 stars - the game comes together seemlessly, with the graphics, story, controls, characters, and use of VR.
This isn't a full locomotion type of experience. I've been sitting on my couch comfortably. Yet the VR is critical in making this game what it is. The view is 3rd person and 1st person at the same time; you are remotely hacked into the environment, security cameras are your eyes, and you are the main characters eyes. You direct her, and you'll need every camera view to see every angle, to know what's ahead. Some things you can directly interact with by hacking. some, you interact with using Hope. The object is to NOT get caught, to avoid detection and be a ghost.
If I were to compare this to any other game, I would say Metal Gear (the classic) combined with Hitman in VR. You're playing 2 people at once, and you can feel them each independent yet seemless.
Great job, devs. I don't think the newness will wear off for a while.

More 3D than VR

Ill start by saying I didnt get further than the second chapter but this feels (mechanics and visuals) like a game from several console generations ago (early 2000s generation).
The distinction for me between 3D and full VR is that with the flip between fixed camera perspectives the game feels more like a nice 3D experience than a full VR one (where you can move about freely in a full virtual world).
Ultimately I got frustrated quite early on in the second chapter when evading the guards the main protagonist didnt go where I wanted her to resulting in numerous lengthy trips back to the cell.

Good story but just not enough of a VR experience and too fiddly to keep me playing.

JWheezyAug 11, 2019 at 4:19 PM
MOSS style experience Quest perfection!

I recently finished Moss and I Expect You to Die and was looking for another high quality sit down game and Republique VR delivers. This game seems fully optimized for VR to me. You are able to control your 3D character in a 3D environment similar to the perspective in Moss. In Republique however you will have much more variety in perspective as you take control of security cameras and navigate the beautiful map and phone interface. The character interaction is point and click and offers a variety of stealth and tactical options. Lots of fun. Vivid story and voice acting. Headphones are a must for me. Playing as a hacker whos viewpoint originates from various security cameras in the environment really lends itself to the Quest field of view for a more naturally immersive experience.

Developer ResponseAug 8, 2019 at 3:14 PM

Hi Doctori, Sorry to hear you're having difficulty saving. Are you playing with the "Student" costume? Wearing the Student costume forces players to manually save by collecting video tapes strewn throughout the game. If you were *not* using the Student costume and are having issues saving, please contact support at camouflaj dot com and we will try to get your issue resolved. If you were wearing the Student costume and this information resolves your issue, please update your review and let us know - we'd really appreciate it!
